title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes the official streaming home of MLB.TV for the upcoming baseball season.
MLB.TV costs $134.99 for ESPN Unlimited subscribers, $149.99 otherwise, including a free month of ESPN Unlimited.
Current MLB.TV subscribers automatically renew; free ESPN Unlimited offer available, subscription changes via ESPN app.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Celtics' Jayson Tatum participated in a G League practice with the Maine Celtics, increasing speculation about his potential return.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement about Tatum's performance, though no timeline for his return is provided.
Tatum continues recovery from an Achilles tear and hasn't been ruled in for games yet, according to team injury reports.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the most educated state in the U.S. according to WalletHub's 2026 report.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree; nearly 22% have an advanced degree.
Vermont and Maryland follow Massachusetts in education rankings, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia rank lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card, with Massachusetts ties, is up for auction, closing February 21.
The T206 Wagner was originally found in a Sweet Caporal Cigarettes pack by Morton Bernstein in early 1900s.
Ken Goldin from 'King of Collectibles' is auctioning the card, expected to sell for over $4.7 million.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman to start for Team USA against Denmark in 2026 Winter Olympics, marking his Olympic debut.
Swayman is 22-12-3 this season with a 2.92 GAA and .903 save percentage for the Boston Bruins.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also feature against Denmark, paired with Quinn Hughes.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A dead 3-year-old North Atlantic right whale was found off Virginia, identified by New England Aquarium scientists.
This marks the second right whale death in two weeks, worsening the plight of the critically endangered species.
The deceased whale is the 43rd in the ongoing North Atlantic Right Whale Unusual Mortality Event since 2017.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A total of 260 flu-related deaths have been reported in Massachusetts this season, including seven children.
The most recent state data highlights 253 adult and seven pediatric deaths due to influenza in Massachusetts.
Health officials urge vaccination amid declining cases in February, after a January surge strained hospitals.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department's Valentine’s Day post encourages reporting exes with outstanding warrants, humorously promoting 'special' police rides.
The Facebook post, featuring a themed flyer, received nearly 7,000 likes and over 400 comments, engaging the community.
Similar Valentine-themed warrant reminders have been issued by police in New Hampshire, Ohio, Nebraska, and New York.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer are practicing at second and third base during the Red Sox spring training.
Red Sox Manager Alex Cora aims to solidify the infield lineup 'sooner rather than later' before the season starts.
Both Durbin and Mayer have experience at multiple infield positions, adding versatility to the Red Sox roster.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Ashton Grant, Patriots QBs coach, will not pursue NFL offensive coordinator roles, planning to stay in New England.
Grant played a key role in developing QB Drake Maye, who led the league in completion percentage and QBR.
Grant and head coach Mike Vrabel have a history, collaborating previously in Cleveland before reuniting at the Patriots.
